meanings.definition: Moving or heading towards a higher point or destination.
meanings.sent1: The upbound train was filled with excited passengers.
meanings.sent2: The hikers were upbound to the mountain peak.
meanings.sent3: The upbound balloons soared gracefully in the sky.
meanings.sent4: Her spirits were upbound, reaching new heights of happiness.
meanings.sent5: The upbound river flowed swiftly towards the waterfall.

meanings.definition: Directed or going in an upward direction.
meanings.sent1: The upbound elevator carried us to the top floor.
meanings.sent2: The kite flew upbound into the clear blue sky.
meanings.sent3: The upbound rocket launched into space with a loud roar.
meanings.sent4: His upbound career trajectory showed no signs of slowing down.
meanings.sent5: The upbound staircase led to the hidden attic room.
